subtitle: A wonderful little treat!

method.text: Preheat oven to 220°C. Preheat grill to medium heat.

Roll out the pastry on a lightly floured surface until it is 5mm thick. Cut out rounds with a 8 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> cm round pastry cutter. Take a 6cm round pastry cutter and make a light incision around the inside edge of the pastry to mark out a lid.
Brush with one of the egg yolks. Place on a dampened baking tray. Place the rounds in the oven for 5-8 min or until well risen and golden.

Meanwhile: peel and slice the kiwi fruit; and peel and segment the oranges. Soak the fruit in <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> of the champagne. When the pastry is cooked, carefully remove the pastry lids and reserve. Gently warm the soaked fruit in a saucepan for 1-2 min and arrange in the tartlet cases.

For the sabayon, whisk the remaining champagne with three egg yolks and the sugar, until it is pale and starts to thicken. Pour over the tartlets. Place tartlets under the grill for 3-5 min or until golden. Serve immediately topped with the pastry lids.

title: Orange and kiwi fruit tartlets with a champagne sabayon
